values:
I really should be sleeping right now - I'm supposed to be up at 2:15 AM to get dressed and leave the house to pick up coffee and doughnuts and be at work for a bright and early start on inventory at 3AM. 

Now, considering that I just pulled a 12 hour 20 minute day counting the clothting inventory and chased it with another 4 hours of ballroom teaching, the fact that I'm still awake and able to type this is insane. Tomorrow I'll have a longer inventory day combined with another 3 teaching hours.


Sleep. Definitely overrated. I'm so much more productive without it.

Here's the start of something new that I thought I should start keeping track of - the "Life as I Know It" series - designed for all of you to shake your head at my idiot-o-cracy and for me to look back on later and wonder what the heck I was thinking.

Today's deep thought: I'm not getting any younger, and it might just be time for a change. Where the heck do you start with a life alteration?

I'm not sure that I want to dance anymore. Definitely need a better paying job. I want a house. So much to do...

I just looked back at some memories that I had saved, and yeesh, I've got some great friends. Sure I may not get to see them often, and I may not always be happy with them, but they are still the best things I've got going. Thanks guys!

I got my phone back!!! OH HAPPY DAY!!!!


Only goes to show that a week without your phone can promote craziness.

missmusic just told me about a wonderful site - Theknot.com for all my wedding planning stuff. I just signed up, and I can't believe that it's telling me that there are things I should be doing right now (the date that we're working on  is like, 4  years away?!?!)  I'm really glad that she's volunteering to have her brain picked. Saves me from having to do it anyway! ;)

Is it really a bad thing when you clean your first bathroom at the age of 23?

Is it a true sign that you're normal when you can explain issues in quantum physics but can't keep your shoelace tied during your dance lessons?

Are you truly special when it takes you 2.5 years to clean out your stuff from college?


One of these days I'll have to answer these...

I've finally decided that I'm going to try setting my mind to do certain things...cleaning, training, and building confidence strike high priorities on my list. 

Here's the major to do list:

1)  Get  my pro routines ready for  show in December. Up the technique a bit so I don't get run over come March for Tri-State Challenge.

2) Get all the bills and stuff organized and cleared up.

3) Get myself on a regular beautification regimen - facials, nails, the whole nine.

So simple, and yet, so elusive when you're thinking about 30 other things per minute during the course of a day.

I guess I'll start by cleaning now....

As I sat down today rifling though my Yahoo inbox on a whim, I realized the forwarding I had set up a while ago is now no longer in existance. No wonder why I thought I was missing something - I was missing everything!!! Grrr. Oh well, I guess it'll take some time for me to reclaim my life.....sigh.

Since I'm so happy for them and they deserve a big announcement like this...hehehe...


Congratulations  to Jon and Jess on their recent engagement!!!!



There, that's better. Just needed to get that out of the way. That is all. Thank you. :-D

After numerous adventures, attempts at stabbing people for stupidity, and general bad and hostile feelings, things are starting to get back to some semblance of normal. I'm officially graduating in May - no thanks to certain people I was surrounded by last year - and I think I'm in a mildly better place because of it. I have to help Andre take care of business because he is only a few credits off of graduating. Kinda funny that this is coming from the guy that keeps telling me that he can't wait to start planning our life together and knows that he has to graduate in order to make this happen, but what can you do.

I have a lot of important decisions to make in the not-so-distant future. I need to find a job now for once school ends. I also need to figure out whether I'm going to stick around here or try something new, even though my parents won't be overjoyed at the prospect...I've been invited to take some time off in VA by the couple that actually brought us together. The sad thing is I'm actually contemplating it seriously. I stayed here initially for undergraduate because I was afraid to let someone go. I don't want to make that mistake twice, and I think it might be good for me to go away for awhile. Seriously get away. I can't block out all the other things going on in my life just because I don't want to think about them. I have to take care of business...whether I always want to or not.

On the really bright side, Dre almost has an engagement date set in stone. I'm kinda nervous, but at the same time it seems so exciting...:-D

Fun times....

I knew that at some point, I would be a very sad person about the fact that I had those two exams moved to this week.

It finally hit me - I have 3 exams and a paper to do in one week. 

This bites. Wish me luck.

It's been really strange to have an absolutely wonderful weekend with only a minor snag. After the living hell that I've been though as of late, I couldn't be more thankful for it if I tried.

Thursday  -  Reprieve granted!

I was really nevous this particular Thursday because I had 2 exams for the same professor in 2 different classses and I didn't really have the time to study as much as I wanted to the night before. UGH! I knew I shouldn't have stuck around for that Steampunk meeting but...it was so much fun I couldn't help it. The next morning was that pesky snowstorm which caught all of us off guard because by the weather reports, we should have had a snowday. No such luck. Well, I went to drama (making good on my promise to go to all my classes) - luckily we got out a few minutes early so I went to the library to cram. Next I knew I was breathing deeply as I entered the building for Criminology. Well, lo and behold, wouldn't you believe there was a sign up that said "Prof. Holt's Soci 216 class is cancelled, exam Tuesday". You wouldn't believe the moment of shock that I had as I stared at the sign in disbelief. I followed my next instinct, which was to go to Urban Sociology to see if that exam was cancelled too. Sure enough, it was. My weekend started at 10:11 a.m.  and I didn't even know it, plus I had more time to study. Hoo-RAH!

I spent the entire rest of the day at work. That is a whole different story that could take a while to explain. All that need be said is that it was fun and productive.

Friday - Enough is Enough

I was awakened by a phone call from Bryan (my co-coordinator at the SOC) who wanted to know what I meant by an e-mail I sent out to the staff. Arg. Not cool. Again we discover that Janella had not briefed him on anything , and he was on a warpath to take her out. He wanted to meet at 12:15 at the SOC to talk to her. So much for a relatively lazy day.

I went to the SOC where we laid out a plan of attack and made ourselves sound intelligent before we ran upstairs. Figuring I was the more tactful one, I planned on being the one to introduce the topic. Sure enough, when the time came to sit with my supervisor, I very tactfully told her about all of the communication issues going in the SOC and how it was not entirely my fault and Bryan's fault for circumventing channels we did not know existed! She couldn't have been quieter if she tried. For once, I was happy with my supervisor.

Bryan and I had lunch with Suzanne at Chuck and Augies, followed by a trip to the garage to get Bryan's car tested for emissions. Yay fun. Then I drove to RI to get my poor car fixed ( a friend of Andre's knows a great dealer that will fix it for cheap). Some of his friends had a party, so we stuck around and crashed at the house.

Saturday - Easter nervousness and Chili bills

We came back from RI just in time for me to fill in a Saturday shift from 12-4. Kim and Chris stopped by, and we decided to go to the mall after work. We never made it there, we only made it as far as Chili's because they were hungry. It was then that I realized how sweet my arrangement is with Dre when paying a bill. We stopped at the supermarket so Kim could get the ingredients for her Heavenly pie to bring to Chris's house, then went to mine so she could make it.  Hours later, we returned back to campus and I had to console her about  her nervousness and on what to wear. Too funny.

Sunday - Family get togethers

Dre and I left for my house, where we were all departing for  mom's mother's house. I really didn't want to go, but I made myself look nice and left anyway. She lives in a senior community in Hartford, and Dre ran into one of his uncles there! Apparently my *gulp* grandmother and his uncle know each other. Too funny yet again.

I also saw my 4 month old cousin Jada. She's beautiful...and the sad thing is that I can see traits of my cousin Danielle in her. She's going to be quite a handful....

We came home and life was good. Yay.




That brings me to today, where I'm sitting here planning out my week though I should be in lab and just relaxing. Meh, sometimes you just have to take time out for yourself.

It was kinda funny to look up some people on facebook to realize that all the people that I know are in some way, shape, or form connected to other aspects of my life. I really don't know how I feel about that. You'd think I'd be overjoyed to know that everything is interconnected, like I originally hypothesized long ago. But now it makes me think I should run to Bora Bora while there's still time...

I could seriously cry and kiss the ground.

It's finally done. It's over. The work that I couldn't begin due to a whole lot of crap going on in my life is finally getting resolved. As I wrote the last few lines, I realized that something about me seems...different. Lighter. Happier.


Thank goodness this nightmare may have an end in sight!!!

On this day, 5 months ago, my life was on the fast track to nowhere. In a matter of only a few months I changed from intelligent, confident and knowledgeable me to a sniveling heap of human flesh. Three major events changed me from the person everyone knew and some loved to the person that was afraid of her own shadow. Three incidents caused me so much emotional damage that I lost confidence in being able to handle my life, almost withdrew from school, and contemplated eliminating everything from my life to make the separation easier. On this day in history my life changed forever.

On this day - today - I'm taking it back.

I will not run out of fear. I will not give in to this fear that has eaten me alive for half a year. I will not judge myself based on other people's perceptions of me. That's not how I was raised, that's NOT how I want to be, and that is NOT how the story will be written.

I don't care if it takes me the rest of the night to finish what someone didn't want me to start, but I will not rest until it is DONE.

Thought you were smart, didn't you? Thought you could eliminate me, didn't you? Thought I'd die when the only one left to pick up the pieces was the one that was nearly gone?

I only have two words for you...

Take that.

It just dawned on me today that in a very short period of time I will be starting the next chapter of my life.

You'd think this would have sunk in a long time ago. You'd think this would have been obvious before, but it really wasn't. Not till today.

I spent today hiding and studying for my Law and Society midterm essay. I didn't really talk to anyone, save Ken whom I ran into when I ate lunch. The exam itself wasn't too painful....at least afterwards I didn't feel a need to throw up. I was on top of the world for awhile, had a great dinner with friends, came back and did my DDR exercise for the day, and then sat down at my computer to listen to a friend needing help with room assignments. That's when I realized how scary this next phase of my life is.

I'm leaving everything that's familiar - AGAIN. I can barely deal with all the leftover crap from the last mess, now I have to figure out when all this will be resolved, secure gainful employment, and ponder if marriage is really what I want, all while maintaining a composed exterior while trying not  to fall off the deep end. Quite frankly, I'm scared shitless. I haven't felt this way since senior year of high school - of course then I had an obsene number of recommendations and grades to boot. I feel like I have almost nothing. Everything is messed up, and I just want to curl up in a corner and cry the rest of my life away.The only perk to this situation is that I'm not necessarily rebelling against this change, I just feel like I'm less than adequately prepared to start a new beginning. There is no safety net if I screw up...nothing that will save my butt except me. I feel like I cannot articulate what I'm trying to say. I do not feel intelligent anymore. I feel like a very messed up shell of what I used to be. Then again, no one would ever believe what I'm going through. Not that I'd really expect them to. They'd just think I'm messed up and dismiss me as fast as they asked.

At least today was better than yesterday. Maybe someday everything will feel alright again.

So after and extended absence I'm happy to report that I just had the weekend of my life. Considering I need to plan out 2 papers and get a poem read for tomorrow, I'll give a brief summary now and talk about it more later when I have the time.

  1. I made myself over and went to a dance where I had men eating out of the palm of my hand.
  2. Dre and I reaffirmed some of our future goals.
  3. I played with my phone.
  4. Fun at Chuckie Cheese's. 
  5. The deepest kiss known to man.
  6. Fear conquering, inch by inch.
That was a lot of my weekend. More later when I'm not so tired and I have a bit less to do on my plate.

I think it's pretty safe to say I've been through everything worth mentioning in the past 8 months - immaturity, lack of self-esteem, insanity, overload, breakdown, buildup/reconstruction, and reidentification. Phew. I didn't realize how stressful it became until last week when I lost my mind - literally. I think I'll take a few minutes and try to piece together that whole situation when I'm done with this update.

All I can say is that there must be a purpose for me being on this earth regardless of the number of times I've wanted to leave it, since a) I'm still here and b) I actually can look at everything I've been through rather objectively and consider it for the best. Maybe I'm strange, maybe I'm odd, and then again maybe I just need a 2 x 4 upside the head. The world may never know.

Thank goodness for sympathetic friends, chocolate, and Motrin.

Another lonely night in Storrs.

My boyfriend is currently sleeping off the effects of a nice drunken spell and the pain of a hyperextended middle finger.

I'm sitting in my room with Kim and Chris, who are currently being cute...while "All My Life" plays on my computer.

I threw my ring at the wall this evening...


I just want to cry.

I spent most of today doing one of three things - being sick, cleaning, or being bored. Ironically enough there were quite a number of times when all three happened at once.

I'm happy to report one thing though - at least I can breathe out of my nose. This seemed to be a lost art. :)

I awakened to more coughing and sickness, took some medicine, had lunch, took more medicine, and cleaned. Oh, and there was that trip with Kim to Walmart and racing back here to fill in for a couple of hours at work.

I definitely think it's time for a change. Not sure how to make that happen though. I'll start by rearranging this room, maybe switching desks, and playing some DDR. 

Sadly enough, the only thing I'd like right now is to be held by my boyfriend, who unlike me will have both Sunday and Monday off and refuses to come down here without me blatantly saying so due to a paper. I'm not feeling so well, and I have to beg and plead to get someone that's not going to act all phony about caring for me? At least giving me a hug?

I'm so glad I'll be feeling better soon. All this will make a lot more sense.

I should get to work on that other backentry that makes the friends only post make more sense. Next project!

After everything that happened yesterday, I suppose I can feel just fine about the fact that I woke up this morning without wanting to kill and/or die. It really stinks when you're that sick and you just want someone to genuinely care about you.

I figure today I will spend my time cleaning room, cleaning myself (never a bad thing), and trying to get better, since I'm "a tactical disadvantage" to my boyfriend who's competing in the A-10's today and didn't want me in RI.

Had an interesting conversation with a friend last night...I think I'll post it after this.

Crap! I forgot to take my Allegra-D. Darn it!!! Now I have to wait a whole hour before I eat :(

Something is definitely wrong with me.

Things that make you go...chirp.

Woke up this morning feeling sick. Very sick. Sick enough that it actually took more than 2 hours to get out of bed. Glad I set my alarm early...

I skipped my first class to prep for my exam (ironically enough, there's another exam in that class coming up on Thursday.) Took that, then skipped my 2 o'clock to prep for my 4pm, all the while feeling kinda out of it.

Ugh. Time for the world's best red/green tasting drug.

I'm ravenously hungry right now, so I'll be meeting Ken in a few to get some food. I'm in the strangest mood today - part of me thinks that I'm just going to veg today. I'm at the max for any type of monetary spending (I'm so proud that I can pay my credit cards, car insurance, gas, and other crap with only one less than full time job), but that's okay, today will still be fun anyway. I least I don't feel as crappy as I did before ....I actually feel like I'm worth something. Confused? You'll have to check back later when I spend the rest of my day doing backentries because it's way past time.

"I don't wanna go to work today I'd rather stay home and play video games" -Gotta Get Up from Jill Scott.

 Yeah, I'm lazy today. I have a shitload of stuff that needs to be done, and of course, I'm not feeling particularly up to it. Arg. What can you do? Here's what I should be doing today:

  • Taking a shower
  • Talking with the Dean of Students to get paperwork settled
  • Submitting my plans of study
  • Making a decision about what type of job I want to start with
  • Figuring when to take me time
  • Taking D to the train station
Please note how most of these things are actually important. Sigh...at least I do feel better on the whole....but not enough to get up off my bum.

Okay, for those of you that have no clue why I'm as distraught as I have been lately, don't worry - that just means you haven't been around me in the past 3 months. For those of you that somewhat to competely know what the heck is up with me, you have some inkling of a clue as to why I've been so down. All I can say is that we have 2 people to thank for this entry - Kim for keeping my head above water and Dre for helping me to see what I should have seen all along.

Today was okay. Woke up barely on time enough for my 9:30 Drama class, followed by Criminology. Urban Sociology was cancelled, so I took some time to catch up on more "in-office" SOC work, including doing the rest of the work schedule for the rest of the semester. Yay.

I had another episode again. These are really not fun. Ironically enough, Kim and Dre saved the day, and I'm thinking that it's time for me to grow into my mold.

This is something that means a lot to me, strangely enough. The way it should be. Declaration of Personal Intent:I, being of sound mind and body, declare the following statements as items of Personal Intention:1) I will never again base my concept of self worth on people who are idiots. They don't know what they are missing and I do not have time for such tomfoolery.2) I will make sure to take time out for myself everyday - WITHOUT a menagerie in my room.3) I will believe in my own strength because I am not a failure. I am a beautiful, smart, intelligent person, and I will be until the day I die. If you don't like it, tough.4) I will never again feel obligated to play hostess 24/7. I need naps too, darn it.5) I will conquer all the issues in my past ... and then leave them there.6) I will reprioritize everything that matters to me - and decorate everything I own in post-its as a reminder.7) Never again will anyone chase me out of what's rightfully mine. Regardless of how much they want it, I want it more, so they can kiss my *beeeeeeeeep*.8) I am complete all by myself. Any one or thing that I am attached to will complement me, not control, belittle, or irritate me for extended periods of time.9) My brain is just as big if not larger than the professors I deal with. I will make them understand my points and I will get my 4.0.10) I will not compromise on things that matter to me the most. Period.

I just finished a 3 page Law and Society paper for my class at 3:30. Should have been done with it last night, but of course there's always some fun drama to deal with. Now off to clean my room, print this out, go to lab, team meeting, class, dinner w/Jackie, and then a crapload of work. Yikes.

I need a nap. No nap for me. Poo.

I coulda been writing my paper.

I shoulda been writing my paper.

I woulda been writing my paper, but I don't feel the need to exert that much effort.

Who knew today would be half as crazy as it has been.

Went to class after staying up with KA till 3:30. Darn estrogen trip. Love her anyway though. Sprinted to my Drama and Criminology classes, then came back here to tear up the room hunting for the elusive ID. Found that, went to Urban Soc and Social Justice, then came back here where I mediated a fight between a couple of dating friends, talked to my boyfriend and a potential new roommate, and stared at all the stuff I need to get done.

If tomorrow's anything like today was, it's going to merit a lot more than just a couple of lines.

Well, I'm here at work, which normally I find really fun and enjoyable, but there's nothing I can really do right now until a)tomorrow or b)someone makes some electronics appear, stat. Oh well...only 1 hour and 48 more minutes to kill...yippee...
A good friend of mine just told me that a girl thinks he's perfect. Whoa.

Well, today has been quite oxymoronic. Quite oxymoronic indeed.

I woke up this morning to discover, much to my happiness, that I didn't have to help Dave prep for his competition. I really wasn't in the mood to go back to UConn after being there already the last 4 days I was supposed to have off. The phone call came at about 10 o'clock this morning, so I promptly jumped for joy, ran upstairs, and tried to lay down for the first time in weeks.

OXYMORONIC OCCURENCE 1: And then I get another phone call. It's Bryan, telling me that I need to fill out my timecard before 5pm today.

Now, of course when I went to CSI yesterday there weren't any timecards, but hey, of course they are up there on my day off - which means I have to drive to campus anyway to sign off on it. Of course.

There was going to be a saving grace to all of this - I was going to get my issues with the bank all straightened out, since they were the only ones that could unlock my account. Then I was going to go to the store to get stuff for the surprise dinner I'm making for Dre and his parents, and stop at the house to tidy up and clear out the truck.

OXYMORONIC OCCURRENCE 2: I didn't make it past UConn.

At first I was going to park in the metered parking area, but decided to park in S lot. Sure enough, I see a friend's car in the row across from me! I stopped to call them to see where they were, but they didn't answer.

OXYMORONIC OCCURENCE 3: I didn't have to go to the bank. The flag had magically disappeared off of the account.

I have no clue what to say about that. After weeks of not having the time to fix this account, it's now fine. ARG! The teller just looked at me with this really confused look and said that everything was fine. Sigh. What can you do.

OXYMORONIC OCCURRENCE 4: Well, I went to the SOC where I did another 2 hours worth of work (ON MY DAY OFF).

We (Bryan and I) were going to work some stuff out with the guy that's over our supervisor, since we're transitioning from one to another, but of course the new one was there - and just as clueless as ever. I would have thought she would have been diving headfirst in all of this, but no. She was too afraid to step on the predecessors toes. I suppose I can actually sympathize with that...

OXYMORONIC OCCURRENCE 5: As I'm walking back to the parking lot with my friend, he gets a call from a job - his first one since he graduated in December! 

We decided to stop at the bar in the Nathan Hale Inn to celebrate. Of course I end up staying there till 5. By the time I was finished reliving the good ol' days and what not, it was late and people were driving stupid. To little sense to drive another 15 minutes to tidy up the house when I had to go back there later anyway. And the store? That was out too.

So the plan for today was supposed to be exercise, practice, timecard, bank, store, cleaning house, cleaning truck, cooking, and pampering myself before the craziness that will be tomorrow.

Today ended up as timecard, bank, SOC, and sitting on this computer. Can't win them all I suppose.


In other news, Dre will be coming home tomorrow. This is great, considering I have not spent more than 2 hours with him since December 15th, roughly. What is not so great is that I have to drive his beloved baby (his 2003 truck) to the airport in SLEET at 10 o'clock at night. It wouldn't be so bad if I only had to deal with him, but I also have to make an appearance in front of his parents, who very well might ask me to drive home because they will be tired. Sigh. I guess it's no crazier than anything I dealt with in 2004, right?

Who am I kidding. Nothing could be worse than reliving all of that...and rest assured I won't, darn it.

Well, so far I've spent 1 hour in 2005 and I can already tell you it has to be better than 2004. Why? Think about this:

1. For once I had more than 5 places I could be...and decided to pick the one that allowed me to do what I wanted when I wanted and not have to drive home immediately after.
2. I no longer feel like I have stupid obligations to take care of...only important future plans.
3. I don't have to smell anything that vaguely resembles B.O. (hey, it is something to be thankful for...)

I think this year has the potential to be quite rewarding...let's see what happens...

I'm sitting here at work, chuckling over the fact that I'm working on things that people who get paid 70K a year typically do. I guess that shows either the level of trust or the business of the staff here. If I'm doing things that are so important, then why don't I feel like getting around to doing it? Oh well, lalalalala.....

Do me a favor, before reaing anymore of this LJ, read that subject again, because that summarizes how I feel so well it's not funny.

I can't believe that somehow I made it through all of this, but I did - and ironically enough, I don't look nearly as crazy after having done it, thank goodness. To all of you that have been quitely sending me well wishes, prayers, and the occasional food item to shut me up, thank you. You made my life about a thousand times simpler.

At some point when I finish it entirely, I will update the past in a massive unlock, so if you notice that you see nothing but things you haven't read, don't worry about it.

That having been said, I spent a majority of today sleeping until called and asked if I wanted to tag along to the mall.
I had planned on buying this killer coat at NY&C (my first personal purchase in over 2 years that wasn't food), but it didn't look all that great and I really wanted something that would make me feel more like the beautiful, sophisticated woman that I'm supposed to be and less like the scrub that I usually feel like. Go fig. Once I got back, it was all about my new WinTV system...yeah.

You'd think that I would have outgrown things like techtoys by now, but I guess I will always have a little techie inside me.

I did nothing else today but relax - and that's probably a good thing considering everything else I have to do tomorrow. Looks a little something like this:

Call Progressive
E-mail reminder/update everyone about Friday's Demonstration
Check Dre's to make sure everything's peachy
Clean room
Laundry
Call Dean of Students to make an appointment
Call Dentist
Work 12-5
Take   to the mall/Dunkin Donuts/anywhere else

And that's the abbreviated list...man, I should really go to bed...

I just can't take it all anymore.

I don't know how my mother is being strong through all of this. I don't know how my father is dealing with all of this. I don't know if it's just me who's screwed up or if it's the rest of the world. I'm torn between me and this crazed desire to make everyone else happy. It's almost to the point that bad things are happening not because of things I did or didn't do, but because I was imposing them on myself unconcously. There are just so many things that I need to take care of, to do, to be.
 
I did the only thing that I could think of to do that I had never tried. 

I decided to say FU to the rest of the world, I've got to take care of me for a minute.

It's amazing the feeling of liberation you get from just telling people to leave you alone or taking care of things you need taken care of just because it needs to be done. Because you want them to be. No one else.

Thank God I'm starting to learn how to do this before it was too late...

This morning I woke up with a start randomly thinking I forgot to RSVP to something. Well, since I can't figure out what that is, I guess it's nothing....

Then I finally found my Ballroom Master Disk! (YAY!!!) Only problem is, it's not working. It's really not that big of a problem because I did make a backup CD, but I don't remember when I backed it up the last time, so it may be missing a few files. Oh well. 

I've got some friends visiting soon, so I should probably get ready...I just really want to get this CD working...

I just learned basic HTML and how to do passwords in Javascript in one day in an amount of time totalling less than one hour! Why did I do this? And why am I doing it well after 3AM? Does it really matter? :)

Sometimes it's the little things in life that matter.

I woke up this morning and for the first time I didn't have a dreaded fear that I wasn't good enough or that someone was going to yell at me. I've been overly sensitive for awhile now, and I decided to cut the crap last week. It feels so incredibly wonderful!!! Angela called this morning to firm up plans for Sunday as well as to let me bounce a couple of ideas off her. I can't wait to see her this weekend!

For the first time since I started this position I actually feel like I know both what I want to do and how I want to go about it. I have a set plan and people that I know will support something that is well thought out and will ditch anything that doesn't seem productive. After re-reading the bylaws and realizing that I didn't have the descriptions right, a couple of things are going to change...yay.

Aside from doing some much needed "me things" like sleeping in and light brainstorming, I heard the most wonderful song from Jill Scott called "Golden". It's about appreciating life, freedom, and happiness...and being that it's my new focus, that's exactly what I needed as a theme!

Now I'm going to start working on e-mail #2, as well as the agenda for the next meeting. This should be interesting....

I spent a lot of today crying and wishing that things were different. It's hard to put it all up, and I did write a lengthy post on the matter, but I'm tired and it's probably something that should be kept private anyway. So that's exactly where it is.


I'm having a lot of problems relaxing. I can't separate work from personal life, and that's proving to be a very difficult task, especially with a presidency and entrance exams right around the corner. Anyone have any really good ways of getting your mind to turn off after a really long week?

On a good note, I've finally started work on my new costume. Hopefully it'll be ready for the home competition (wait, was I competing in that? eh, probably not) or at least for my next pro-am should I decide to do one. Whoo hoo!!!

Happy birthday to  and I wish her nothing but the best!!!!
You're one of the most interesting and talented people I know... :)

I spent today finishing the floor of my room (YAY!!! CLEAN MATURE LOOKING ROOM!!!) and looking at stuff for the next e-mail I have to send out. I must admit, this is going to be interesting. Very interesting. Hopefully there won't be a lot of death, mayhem, and destruction going on once I send this out.


A couple of days ago a friend of mine told me I was absolutely nuts for trying to go to law school. I think that since somebody probably told Oprah that she couldn't do it, I'm just not going to take it as personally as I have been and just use it as determination to do it that much more. So there.

So now, more cleaning, more sorting of ballroom information, and figuring out what the heck to do about some paperwork for school, and getting this all done before Dre comes back from his job.

Go me.

Well, after the wonderful weekend I had with Andre, the real world kinda seemed so distant, so...removed. I guess that's definitely one of the benefits of seeing someone like him - someone that makes you think that you're on top of the world, someone that makes you realize that the world isn't so doom and gloom.

After a long drive back from RI this morning at the crack of dawn, a nap, and a movie, I realized that I have to get a job. This really wouldn't be so bad of a thing except that no one's going to hire someone this late in the summer for only a month. Whatever job I get has to be a permanent part-time issue - on top of 2 majors (or a major and a minor), a presidential position, and a job that I'll probably get on campus. I knew that the real world could stink, but it doesn't look like I'm going to enjoy this at all. So much for my senior year being fun and a time to celebrate all my hard work...

Theoretically, I should be happy - I definitely won't be bored. I might be sad, but not bored. I think I might curl up and sniffle a bit now.

Well, I guess today goes in the record books as both the best esteem-boosting day and the most aggravating ending to an esteem-boosting day.

After working quite a few hours (with some overtime!) I came home, turned on the air conditioner, and went to sleep. I awakened at 2:15 pm in a state of shock that I had slept that long. After freshening a bit and getting dressed, I wandered downstairs, poked mom to get ready, and then it was off to go shopping for last minute things for the two weddings that I'm going to be attending.

After a brief stop at one Payless, I decided to cash my check at the bank. A man who was also filling out something at the counter asked me if we had met before. I said that it was entirely possible as I've been meeting an insane number of people lately. He then smiled uneasily and asked if I were single, to which I responded no. He then asked if I were marriend, to which I told him no as well. Then he asked which one it was, and I responded that I was seeing someone at the time. He then sighed, said oh well, and told me to have a nice day. He then left the bank and drove away. It was definitely nice to have someone notice me...

Well, I thought that was the funniest thing and promptly laughed all the way to the car. Mom inquired about all my laughter, and I told her what had happened. Quite funny stuff, really. 

The next stop was Buckland, where she could pick up her shoes and I could hunt for any lasp minute necessities. I was greeted by a number of glances and stares as I walked, and I have to admit it felt really really good. It was great, really. More people saying hello and acting like they knew me. Maybe they did and I just didn't realize it. 

We didn't see any shoes for her there, so I harassed mom to go to DSW. Well, as I sat out in the parking lot this woman comes up next to me, gets out of her car, and walks around the car. She informs me that I'm apparently going to do great things for young people. Well, I don't know what to say about that. I'll keep you posted.

When I had my conversation with Dre earlier, he then reminded me that we probably should have reserved a hotel room for the wedding. !@#$%^& simply because I asked him about that 3 weeks ago! Sigh....oh well. I guess I'll just make the trips and call it a day...wish me luck.

Well, I was roaming around on some websites and I found this. I don't know what to say, honestly...okay, so I missed the Ketchup song by like, 2 years, but still...


http://www.madblast.com/view.cfm?type=FunFlash&display=1674

I guess that's what happens when you're overly tired and you just can't help researching old songs.

So I'm not really sure what I want to do with the rest of my day. Gas is kinda expensive, so I don't want to go running all over the place, though job hunting would probably be a wise idea. Meh.

I just finished watching Janet's new video. All I have to say is I completely understand why he'd leave me for that if he could...maybe I should work out or something...wait, that involves effort. Poo.

I am so out of it. I should be a lot more focused than I am right now, but I can't help it! I'm just so out of it...ugh...
